author: Oscar Wilde
text: Time is a waste of money.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: To be natural is such a very difficult pose to keep up.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else`s opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: I am not young enough to know everything.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Life is much too important a thing ever to talk seriously about it.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: How can a woman be expected to be happy with a man who insists on treating her as if she were a perfectly normal human being?

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: I never put off till tomorrow what I can possibly do â€” the day after.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: A man can be happy with any woman as long as he does not love her.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Boys think girls are like books, If the cover doesn't catch their eye they won't bother to read what's inside.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: It's better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: A career is wonderful, but you can't curl up with it on a cold night.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: I live to succeed, not to please you or anyone else.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: A wise girl kisses but doesn't love, listens but doesn't believe, and leaves before she is left.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Give a girl the right shoes and she can conquer the world.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.

author: Marilyn Monroe
text: All little girls should be told they are pretty, even if they aren't.

author: Winston Churchill
text: The problems of victory are more agreeable than those of defeat, but they are no less difficult.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Study history. In history lies all the secrets of statecraft.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm.

author: Winston Churchill
text: The price of greatness is responsibility.

author: Winston Churchill
text: All great things are simple, and many can be expressed in single words: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Never, never, never give in!

author: Winston Churchill
text: I am always ready to learn, but I do not always like being taught.

author: Winston Churchill
text: It's not enough that we do our best; sometimes we have to do what's required.

author: Winston Churchill
text: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.

author: Winston Churchill
text: To improve is to change, to be perfect is to change often.

author: Winston Churchill
text: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Always remember, that I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Although prepared for martyrdom, I preferred that it be postponed.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.

author: Winston Churchill
text: When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber.

author: Winston Churchill
text: I never worry about action, but only inaction.

author: Winston Churchill
text: A joke is a very serious thing.

author: Mark Twain
text: A man's character may be learned from the adjectives which he habitually uses in conversation.

author: Mark Twain
text: To succeed in life, you need two things ignorance and confidence.

author: Mark Twain
text: Fortune knocks at every man's door once in a life, but in a good many cases the man is in a neighbouring saloon and does not hear her.

author: Mark Twain
text: Truth is more of a stranger than fiction.

author: Mark Twain
text: When in doubt, tell the truth.

author: Mark Twain
text: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.

author: Mark Twain
text: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.

author: Mark Twain
text: A classic is something that everybody wants to have read and nobody wants to read.

author: Mark Twain
text: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience this is the ideal life.

author: Mark Twain
text: To cease smoking is the easiest thing I ever did; I ought to know because I've done it a thousand times.

author: Mark Twain
text: All generalizations are false, including this one.

author: Mark Twain
text: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.

author: Mark Twain
text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.

author: Mark Twain
text: It usually takes more than three weeks to prepare a good impromptu speech.

author: Mark Twain
text: There are several good protections against temptations, but the surest is cowardice.

author: Mark Twain
text: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist, except an old optimist.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Unthinking respect for authority is the greatest enemy of truth.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

author: Albert Einstein
text: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree.

author: Albert Einstein
text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.

author: Albert Einstein
text: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Once you stop learning, you start dying.
